dcterms:creator: L. Liu
S. Zhao
H. Chen
A. Wang
dcterms:description: Contains voice data from AD patients and healthy controls, extracting spectral features.
dcterms:title: VBSD Dataset

dcterms:creator: A. Karakostas
A. Briassouli
K. Avgerinakis
I. Kompatsiaris
M. Tsolaki
dcterms:description: This dataset consists of voice data from AD patients and healthy controls. The dataset covers four tasks, including picture description, description of pictures from memory, sentence repetition, and rapid pronunciation repetition.
dcterms:title: Dem@Care Dataset

dcterms:creator: J. T. Becker
F. Boiler
O. L. Lopez
J. Saxton
K. L. Mcgonigle
dcterms:description: The Pitt Corpus collects voice data from participants in Alzheimer’s and related dementia research at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine. The dataset includes description tasks, word fluency tasks, story recall tasks, and sentence construction tasks.
dcterms:title: Pitt Dataset

dcterms:creator: S. Luz
F. Haider
S. de la Fuente
D. Fromm
B. MacWhinney
dcterms:description: This dataset was created for the ADReSS challenge, where participants were matched for age and gender to minimize bias risk in the prediction task. The dataset includes speech recordings and textual oral picture descriptions from participants based on the Cookie Theft picture from the Boston Diagnostic Aphasia Examination.
dcterms:title: ADReSS Dataset

dcterms:creator: D. Lu
K. Popuri
D. et al.
dcterms:description: The Alzheimer’s Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) database collects and analyzes a large-scale dataset consisting of neuroimaging, biomarkers, cognitive assessments, and clinical data.
dcterms:title: ADNI Dataset

dcterms:description: The Open Access Series of Imaging Studies (OASIS) aims to share brain neuroimaging datasets with researchers in related fields. OASIS is available in the following versions: OASIS-1 includes 434 cross-sectional MRI scans from 416 subjects aged 18 to 96 years. OASIS-2 consists of 373 longitudinal MRI scans from 150 subjects. OASIS-3 includes 2,842 longitudinal MRI scans, 2,157 PET scans, and 1,472 CT scans from 1,379 subjects.
dcterms:title: OASIS Dataset

dcterms:creator: J. M. Massaro
R. B. D. Srem
L. M. Sullivan
A. Beiser
C. DeCarli
R. Au
M. F. Elias
P. A. Wolf
dcterms:description: Managing and analysing data from a large-scale study on framingham offspring relating brain structure to cognitive function.
dcterms:title: FHS Dataset

dcterms:description: The National Alzheimer’s Coordinating Center (NACC) is responsible for developing and maintaining a database that collects participant information from 29 Alzheimer’s Disease Centers (ADCs) funded by the National Institute on Aging (NIA).
dcterms:title: NACC Dataset

dcterms:description: The overall objective of this study was to identify variables that can predict the subsequent development of mild to moderate Alzheimer’s disease symptoms in cognitively normal individuals.
dcterms:title: BIOCARD Dataset

dcterms:description: The dataset consists of six Activities of Daily Living (ADLs), including sitting, standing, walking, lying, going upstairs, and going downstairs. These ADLs were performed by 30 participants ranging in age from 19 to 49 years.
dcterms:title: Smartphone-based single-sensor dataset

dcterms:description: The dataset was developed using four inertial sensors placed on the chest, right hip, right wrist, and ankle. A total of 19 participants (26±8 years old) took part in the experiment.
dcterms:title: Multi-sensor dataset
